comments:
build N20050623

- changed the RCP performance tests to set the preference for the default
perspective
- got the following in the log:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-06-23 11:55:10.751
!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in:
"org.eclipse.core.runtime".
!STACK 0
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Workbench has not been created yet.

sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:334)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:278)

	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:948)


The problem is that PlatformUIPreferenceListener assumes that the workbench is
running.  It should check PlatformUI.isWorkbenchRunning() before calling
getWorkbench().  Alternatively, is should add/remove the listener in line with
the workbench lifecycle, rather than adding it in the preference initializer.

If the latter change is done, it should be created for a specific IWorkbench
instance, and not use PlatformUI.getWorkbench().

This also causes a secondary failure trying to bring up the error dialog from
SafeRunnable.handleException, because neither SWT nor JFace have been
initialized, so the Display.getCurrent() in getImageRegistry() returns null.
